details:
* [CVE-2017-5974](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5974)
Heap-based buffer overflow in the \_\_zzip\_get32 function in fetch.c
 in zziplib allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
 (crash) via a crafted ZIP file.
* [CVE-2017-5975](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5975)
Heap-based buffer overflow in the \_\_zzip\_get64 function in fetch.c
 in zziplib allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
 (crash) via a crafted ZIP file.
* [CVE-2017-5976](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5976)
Heap-based buffer overflow in the zzip\_mem\_entry\_extra\_block
 function in memdisk.c in zziplib allows remote attackers to cause
 a denial of service (crash) via a crafted ZIP file.
* [CVE-2017-5978](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5978)
The zzip\_mem\_entry\_new function in memdisk.c in zziplib allows
 remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds
 read and crash) via a crafted ZIP file.
* [CVE-2017-5979](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5979)
The prescan\_entry function in fseeko.c in zziplib allows remote
 attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference
 and crash) via a crafted ZIP file.
* [CVE-2017-5980](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5980)
The zzip\_mem\_entry\_new function in memdisk.c in zziplib allows
 remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer
 dereference and crash) via a crafted ZIP file.
* [CVE-2017-5981](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5981)
seeko.c in zziplib allows remote attackers to cause a denial of
 service (assertion failure and crash) via a crafted ZIP file.


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these problems have been fixed in version
0.13.56-1.1+deb7u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your zziplib packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
